Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery cup with everted rim; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; added white lines; below, chevron pattern between white lines; exterior: lip glazed with added white laurel leaf frieze; handle zone reserved with dilute line at top; wall glazed; graffito inscription on exterior.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The piece is may be from the same cup as Oxford AN1925.608e(3), British Museum 1965,0930.400 and 1965,0930.400a; however it cannot be from the same piece as Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum GR.323.1899, which is also close, since the inscription cannot fit. Also there is no assured traces of a chevron frieze on any of the other fragments. Schlotzhauer's suggestion that the sherd may come from a kantharos, as Boardman, J., Excavations in Chios 1952-1955. Greek Emporio. Annual of the British School at Athens Supplement 6. Oxford 1967, 161, no. 767, cannot stand.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 186, NAU161, pl. 36a-b)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 741, no. 1001)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 100, no. 304.1, pl. XXXII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1919) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5910 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
